post_text: Paradise and Salisbury Families: On Tuesday, September 15 we will offer our curriculum nights virtually. From 6:30-7:30 pm you will be able to connect with your children’s facilitators using Google Meet. A flyer will be sent home with your child tomorrow that contains additional information, the schedule, links to connect with facilitators, and support resources. Please review it so you are ready for Tuesday. This information will also be posted to our building webpages for easy access to meeting links. Please call the school office with any questions. Thank you!

shared_text:
Pequea Valley High School
September 4 at 2:36 PM ·

Attention Seniors!⁣⁣
⁣⁣
Prestige Studios will be at @PequeaValleyHS next Wed-Fri to take all formal yearbook photos. In order to be included in the yearbook, you must have a formal portrait taken at this time. ⁣⁣
⁣⁣
Please note that the “Deluxe” package does not include any fees or obligations to purchase. The upgraded “Ultimate” package is 100% optional. ⁣⁣
⁣⁣
You will be receiving a postcard from the company that includes information about this senior rite of passage! ⁣⁣
⁣⁣
In the meantime, you can choose a time slot that is convenient to you by clicking the #linkinbio or by following the directions below. ⁣⁣
⁣⁣
1⃣ Go to the PrestigePortraits.com website to "self-schedule" your appointment. ⁣⁣
2⃣ Use the code on your postcard OR search for Pequea Valley by entering Kinzers, Pennsylvania.⁣⁣
3⃣ Choose your day and time.⁣⁣
⁣⁣
If you have any questions about this process, do not hesitate to reach out to Mrs. Koberstein!⁣⁣
⁣⁣
#deluxe #ultimate #seniors #package #postcard #linkinbio #pvbravesproud

post_text:
Attention Class of 2021!
Senior portraits are scheduled to take place in the PVHS auditorium September 9-11- next Wednesday, Thursday and Friday. Directions on how to choose an appointment time slot were sent to all seniors on their Pequea Valley email from Mrs. Koberstein. You must choose your appointment day and time in advance due to COVID-19 restrictions. Please contact Mrs. Koberstein with any questions about scheduling your appointment.

Directions on how to choose an appointment time slot were sent to all seniors on their Pequea Valley email from Mrs. Koberstein. You must choose your appointment day and time in advance due to COVID-19 restrictions. Please contact Mrs. Koberstein with any questions about scheduling your appointment.

post_text: PV Online Learners: A drive-up learning material pickup event is scheduled for tomorrow, Friday, August 28. Elementary learners should go to their respective school buildings between 2-5pm to pickup learning materials. Secondary learners who have been contacted by their facilitators to pickup learning materials should go to their building between 1-4pm. If you have questions, please contact your child's school office.

post_text:
PV traditional learners - Please charge your devices, login to them to make sure your password from last year works, and bring them to school tomorrow!

If you have your learner ID badge, make sure you wear it to school tomorrow.

Remember to check the BusPlanner portal to find your child’s bus pickup and dropoff schedule. Instructions and more information about BusPlanner access, technology, and Sapphire Community portal accounts can be found at pequeavalley.org under Announcements.

Learners are required to wear a face covering unless a doctor’s note is provided to the building administration. Pequea Valley will provide learners with 2 reusable face coverings during the first week of school. Please ensure your child has a face covering for the first day of school.

Lastly, remember that there are early dismissals everyday this week! Thank you and see you all tomorrow!

9th grade orientation, which was originally scheduled for Monday, Aug 24th, has been re-scheduled to take place on Tuesday, August 25, during the school day. post_text: REMINDER - today's tech pickup is for PV Online Learners ONLY from 8-11am and 1-4pm at Paradise, Salisbury, and PVHS (PVIS learners go to PVHS for pickup).
text: REMINDER - today's tech pickup is for PV Online Learners ONLY from 8-11am and 1-4pm at Paradise, Salisbury, and PVHS (PVIS learners go to PVHS for pickup).

post_text:
Tech Pickup for PV Online Learners will take place inside each building lobby 8/21 and 8/24 from 8-11am and 1-4pm. PVIS learners should pickup at PVHS. If you kept your device over the summer, please charge it and login to make sure your password from last year works. If you cannot login to your device, bring it to tech pickup to have it reset.

5th and 9th grade learners also receive new laptops this year. Bring your current technology with you to the tech pickup event to exchange it for your new device!

Please remember you must wear a face covering and socially distance when you attend tech pickup. If you have questions, please contact us. Thank you!

5th and 9th grade learners also receive new laptops this year. Bring your current technology with you to the tech pickup event to exchange it for your new device!

Please remember you must wear a face covering and socially distance when you attend tech pickup. If you have questions, please contact us. Thank you!

post_text: Free PIAA sports physicals will be held at PVHS on July 29th from 5:30 to 8:30pm. All athletes must be registered on Family ID prior to 7/29 to receive a physical. To limit crowds, please come at your assigned time. Last names A-H @5:30; last names I-Q @6:30; last names R-Z @7:30. If you have questions please contact your coach or the high school at 717-768-5500.

shared_text:
The Factory Ministries
June 1 at 2:52 PM ·

We are excited to announce that Pequea Valley School District will continue lunch programming and distribution through The Factory for the next two weeks and are hopeful to continue it through the summer. We will be updating you with this information throughout the summer.

PV families - You will be able to pick up lunches at the Factory Ministries for learners of the Pequea Valley School District on Wednesday June 3 and June 10 12pm-1pm or 5pm-6pm from If you have any questions you can contact Karla Neff at 717-687-9594 or Cathy Koenig at 717-768-5577. Thank you!

shared_text:
Pequea Valley High School
May 27 at 11:01 AM ·

Attention PVHS Learners and Families!⁣
❗️ ⁣
Locker items, class projects and other school materials will be distributed on Monday, June 1 from 9-3. ⁣
✏️⁣
Learners will also turn in any school owned items like books, class materials, athletic equipment and band/chorus instruments and attire. ⁣
🎷🎾⁣
Learners in grades 9-11 will NOT be returning laptops this year. If you do not wish to hold on to your laptop over the summer, please bring it along on June 1. ⁣
💻⁣
This event will take place “drive by” style. Learners should report to PVHS by entering off of 772 near the stadium drive. We look forward to seeing you on June 1 between 9-3! ⁣
🚘⁣
#class #projects #school #books #equipment #band #instruments #drive #athleticequipment #pvhs #june1

post_text: Attention PVIS and PVHS Families! Locker items, class projects and other school materials will be distributed on Monday, June 1 from 9a-3p. Learners can also turn in any school-owned items like books, class materials, athletic equipment and band/chorus instruments and attire. Learners in grades 7-11 are not required to turn in laptops this summer, but have the option to do so on June 1. This event will take place “drive by” style. Grades 7-8 should report to PVIS and enter at the main entrance; grades 9-11 should report to PVHS and enter near the stadium. We look forward to seeing you on June 1 between 9a-3p!
text: Attention PVIS and PVHS Families! Locker items, class projects and other school materials will be distributed on Monday, June 1 from 9a-3p. Learners can also turn in any school-owned items like books, class materials, athletic equipment and band/chorus instruments and attire. Learners in grades 7-11 are not required to turn in laptops this summer, but have the option to do so on June 1. This event will take place “drive by” style. Grades 7-8 should report to PVIS and enter at the main entrance; grades 9-11 should report to PVHS and enter near the stadium. We look forward to seeing you on June 1 between 9a-3p!

shared_text:
Pequea Valley High School is at Tel Hai Retirement Community.
January 7 at 5:57 PM · Honey Brook, PA ·

Check out this article that was just published by the @townlivelyepc. ⁣⁣
⁣⁣
It highlights juniors Megan Yoder & Bailey Henshaw, who are carrying on @PequeaValley's tradition of bringing students and senior citizens together. ⁣⁣
⁣⁣
Several times per month, the girls travel to the Tel Hai Retirement Community and provide technology support sessions for their residents.⁣⁣
⁣⁣
Way to go girls! For more on this, check out the article:

https://www.townlively.com/connecting-the-generations/ ⁣⁣
⁣⁣
#townlively #pvbravesproud #pvbraveslearn #telhai #seniorcitizens #seniorcitizen #carryon #article #seniors #retirement #technology #support #linkinbio #highlights #retirementcommunity #technologysupport #beststudents⁣⁣
⁣⁣
Photo Credit: Ann Mead Ash

shared_text:
Together Initiative Network
October 14, 2019 at 9:36 PM ·

Today's pep rally at Salisbury Elementary School marked the kick-off of the Together Initiative Network's upcoming Together Ride!

From October 26-28, 13 cyclists, 6 motorcyclists, and 5 support drivers will make their way to
Harvard Graduate School of Education from Paradise, Pennsylvania.

The 400-mile relay-style ride will take place over 3 days, with cyclists traveling from the Together Community Center in Paradise, Pennsylvania to Harvard Graduate School of Education (HGSE) in Boston, Massachusetts.

Pequea Valley School District The Factory Ministries Grace Point Church School District of Lancaster Pennsylvania Department of Education

post_text: We are excited to offer our elementary families the FLUency Health Program. Each family who signs up will receive a Kinsa Smart Therometer. Please visit kinsaforschools.com on your phone, download the Kinsa app, and search for our schools to join. Thank you for your help in keeping our learners healthy and in class to learn. If you have any questions please call your child’s school nurse. Thank you!

post_text: Very #PVBravesProud of our STEM program! Congrats to Rob and Mitch, you both make us #PVBravesProud
shared_text:
Lancaster-Lebanon IU13
April 26, 2017 at 3:00 PM ·

IU13 is pleased to announce the 2017 STEM Awards recipients! STEM School of the Year is awarded to Pequea Valley High School. Secondary STEM Teacher of the Year is Rob Webb, and Elementary STEM Teacher of the Year is Mitch Swords both of Pequea Valley School District. Congratulations goes out to these recipients! The panel of external judges worked diligently to review all nominations for these awards and were impressed by the caliber of work exhibited by all nominees. IU13 looks forward to honoring the recipients at the 2017 STEM Awards Banquet on May 24, 2017.
text:
Very #PVBravesProud of our STEM program! Congrats to Rob and Mitch, you both make us #PVBravesProud

Lancaster-Lebanon IU13
April 26, 2017 at 3:00 PM ·

IU13 is pleased to announce the 2017 STEM Awards recipients! STEM School of the Year is awarded to Pequea Valley High School. Secondary STEM Teacher of the Year is Rob Webb, and Elementary STEM Teacher of the Year is Mitch Swords both of Pequea Valley School District. Congratulations goes out to these recipients! The panel of external judges worked diligently to review all nominations for these awards and were impressed by the caliber of work exhibited by all nominees. IU13 looks forward to honoring the recipients at the 2017 STEM Awards Banquet on May 24, 2017.
